application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
T1 - Norway Spruce - fell - excessive sway and danger of falling on building.
T2 / T3 - Ash - fell - low amenity value as self seeded. Replant in better position where it can be cared for.
T4 - Holly - fell - extremely low amenity value as self seeded and obstructing access.
T5 - Horse Chestnut - remove limb and crown reduction: 2.5 m.
T6 - Laurel - crown reduce by 6 m.
T7 - Lime group - reduce and clean by 15%
T8 - Ash - fell - wrong tree in wrong location (self seeded) - replant standard ash in better position
T9 - Lime - fell main trunk + reduce stems by 50%
T10 - Sycamore - fell - excessive shading and within 7m of building - replant on boundary of property.
T11 - Oak - remove upright limbs. Tree has fallen into water and concern over health of tree.
decision_conditions: T1 - Norway Spruce - fell - excessive sway and danger of falling on building.
T2 / T3 - Ash - fell - low amenity value as self seeded. Replant in better position where it can be cared for.
T4 - Holly - fell - extremely low amenity value as self seeded and obstructing access.
T6 - Laurel - crown reduce by 6 m.
T7 - Lime group - reduce and clean by 15%
T8 - Ash - fell - wrong tree in wrong location (self seeded) - replant standard ash in better position
T10 - Sycamore - fell - excessive shading and within 7m of building - replant on boundary of property.

The group of trees identified as T1, T2, T3, T4, T6, T7, T8, T9, and T10, within the grounds of The Lodge Harwood Hall Lane are exempt from Haverings TPO 7/49. These trees post date the TPO 7/49, and permission is not needed for works to these trees.
It is recommended that the following trees can be pruned as identified as been on Havering's TPO plan 7/49 as W29 mixed Plantation.
T5 - Horse Chestnut - reduce  limb growing to towards Wooden building and crown reduction: 2.5 m.
T9 - Lime - reduce by 50%, lapsed pollards and thin 10%

T11 - Oak - remove upright limbs by up to 3m, reduce remaining canopy by up to 3m. Tree has fallen into water and concern over health of tree, so to reduce crown weight and the stress to rest of the tree.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
Reason:
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
Reason:
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
Reason:
To prevent the accumulation of consents.

It is suggested that you engage the services of a qualified and fully insured tree surgeon to carry out the above work on your behalf (you should ask to see the contractor's insurance certificate and make sure that it is up to date).
